bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, December 23, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, December 23, 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, To the Department of State.
Transportation of the remains of Hon., Alexander Clark, late Minister Resident and Consul General of the United States, at Monroivia, Liberia. Account and vouchers of expenses involved.
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, December 23, 1891.
Hon., William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: According to the instruction contained in your No 11, of July 21, last, I have to inform the Department that, the remains of Hon., Alexander Clark, late United States, Minister &c were shipped to Mr George W. Appleton, Muscatine, Iowa, to the care of Messers, Yates & Porterfield, Now York, per Bank "Liberia" on the 10th instant, and I have as advised the relative of the late Minister.
account and voucher for the expenses involved, which, I trust will prove satisfactory.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul
